Package banking

Class Bank

  • java.lang.Object
    • banking.Bank
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Bank
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Manages a collection of bank accounts with persistence and scheduled interest services.

    This class provides:

    • Account registration and retrieval
    • Persistent storage using Java serialization
    • Automated interest application via scheduled executor service
    • Thread-safe account management using ConcurrentHashMap

    Thread Safety: This class is thread-safe. Account operations use concurrent collections, and the scheduler runs on a separate thread pool.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    BankSystem Team
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public Bank()

    • Method Detail

      • openAccount

        public void openAccount​(BankAccount account)
                 throws AccountStatusException
        Opens a new bank account and registers it in the system.
        Parameters:
        account - the account to open (must not be null)
        Throws:
        AccountStatusException - if an account with the same account number already exists

      • getAccount

        public BankAccount getAccount​(java.lang.String id)
                       throws AccountStatusException
        Retrieves an existing account by its account number.
        Parameters:
        id - the account number to retrieve
        Returns:
        the account associated with the given ID
        Throws:
        AccountStatusException - if no account exists with the given ID

      • payGlobalInterest

        public void payGlobalInterest()
                       throws AccountStatusException
        Applies interest to all savings accounts in the bank.

        This method iterates through all registered accounts and applies interest to those that are instances of SavingsAccount. Checking accounts and other account types are skipped.

        Throws:
        AccountStatusException - if interest application fails for any account

      • startInterestService

        public void startInterestService()
        Starts a background service that automatically applies interest to all savings accounts at regular intervals.

        The service runs every 10 seconds (simulating nightly batch processing) on a separate thread. The scheduler continues running until stopServices() is called.

        Note: In a production environment, this would typically run once per day using a cron job or scheduled task.

      • stopServices

        public void stopServices()
        Stops all background services including the interest application scheduler.

        This method should be called before the application shuts down to ensure a graceful shutdown of all background threads.

      • saveData

        public void saveData()
        Persists all bank account data to disk using Java serialization.

        The accounts map is serialized to a file named "bank.dat" in the current working directory. This allows account data to be preserved between application runs.

        Note: The scheduler is marked as transient and is not serialized.

      • loadData

        public void loadData()
        Loads previously saved bank account data from disk.

        Attempts to deserialize account data from "bank.dat". If the file doesn't exist, the method returns silently. If the file exists but cannot be read, an error message is printed.

        All existing accounts in memory are cleared before loading to ensure consistency with the saved state.

      • createNewCustomer

        public void createNewCustomer​(java.lang.String username,
                              java.lang.String password,
                              java.lang.String ownerName,
                              java.lang.String accountType)
                       throws AccountStatusException,
                              UserStatusException
        Registers a new customer with a user account and bank account.

        This method creates both a User (for authentication) and a BankAccount (Savings or Checking) in a single operation. The account ID is generated automatically using UUID.

        Parameters:
        username - the username for authentication (must be unique)
        password - the password for the user
        ownerName - the name of the account owner
        accountType - either "savings" or "checking" (case-insensitive)
        Throws:
        UserStatusException - if the username already exists
        AccountStatusException - if the account type is invalid

      • authenticateUser

        public User authenticateUser​(java.lang.String username,
                             java.lang.String password)
                      throws InvalidCredentialsException
        Authenticates a user with their username and password.

        Validates the username exists and the password matches. Returns the User object if authentication succeeds.

        Note: In a production system, passwords should be hashed using a secure algorithm like bcrypt or PBKDF2.

        Parameters:
        username - the username to authenticate
        password - the password to verify
        Returns:
        the authenticated User object
        Throws:
        InvalidCredentialsException - if username doesn't exist or password is incorrect
